4d0e901abae1.bio: Lawyer by day. Has Been by night. Love sports & don't care who knows. Twitter: @pheery12. Editor/Writer for Has Been Sports — https://medium.com/has-been-sports
4d0e901abae1.name: Pat Heery

7973075212bc.bio: Top Medium writer in sports, TV, humor, NFL, NBA. Words at Cauldron, 16 Wins Ring, Sports Pickle, Bleacher Report, Hoop NBA, and others @wheatonbrando
7973075212bc.name: Brandon Anderson

paragraphs.name: b0fd
paragraphs.text: James’s career has begun to feel familiar. Everything that’s been thought about his legacy has probably already been said or written. Even the idea of The Trilogy feels a bit stale. But as media and fans, we can’t let LeBron’s sustained greatness cause fatigue. If there were a 10-year MVP award, LeBron would win it. If the NBA had an Oscars-style honorary award, it’d be bestowed on James in recognition of his mastery of the game of basketball as this generation’s alpha. As he reaches the pinnacle of his career, he’s never truly been more cherishable. He’s a living legend.

paragraphs.name: 6b90
paragraphs.text: “I have enough left for whatever,” James said at All-Star Weekend, per USA Today. “I was ready to play another Finals after Game 7 last year. Give me one or two days’ rest, and I would’ve been ready to go again.” James could be one of the lucky all-time greats, a superhuman who goes his entire career unscathed, like Karl Malone, Tony Gonzalez, or Greg Maddux. It’s possible seven years from now when James is turning 40, he’ll still be in the MVP conversation, just as his son is entering the league as a rookie.

paragraphs.name: 1a37
paragraphs.text: The Block and the 3–1 comeback very well might have been the climax of LeBron’s career: It cemented his legacy as a player who deserves to be on the Mount Rushmore of NBA legends. But with LeBron’s team wavering, the East stronger, and a rubber match against the Warriors potentially looming, it’s possible the climax has yet to come. James’s true turning point could be a fourth Finals win this summer, an event that would strengthen his standing in the greatest of all time conversation. What can you get from a player who has given almost everything he’s got? The answer will not only shape these playoffs, but the rest of LeBron’s career. So let’s enjoy every moment of his story. Someday it’ll be over.

“I have enough left for whatever,” James said at All-Star Weekend, per USA Today. “I was ready to play another Finals after Game 7 last year. Give me one or two days’ rest, and I would’ve been ready to go again.” James could be one of the lucky all-time greats, a superhuman who goes his entire career unscathed, like Karl Malone, Tony Gonzalez, or Greg Maddux. It’s possible seven years from now when James is turning 40, he’ll still be in the MVP conversation, just as his son is entering the league as a rookie.
paragraphs.name: 6b90

aa61fd4fe4db.title: Lebron has been so good for so long that the biggest intrigue remaining for me is what his game…

paragraphs.name: 05dc
paragraphs.text: Lebron has been so good for so long that the biggest intrigue remaining for me is what his game will look like as his athleticism declines. Will Lebron play long enough to do the older Kareem & David Robinson route and hand the team over to the future of the franchise?

cb82976daa0c.title: Lebron’s not on the Mount Rushmore of bball (Jordan, Kareem, Shaq and Magic.)

paragraphs.name: ef16
paragraphs.text: Lebron’s not on the Mount Rushmore of bball (Jordan, Kareem, Shaq and Magic.) He’s amazing, great, etc. but he could never take over and score like the other GOATS do. In the crunch, we’ve seen him disappear in a few game 7s and other key stretches — like his first against the Mavs, several shellackings from the Spurs, and even including the almighty…

paragraphs.text: With a full trophy case.

e762beb71d76.title: And, if LeBron beats GSW in the Finals, an opponent who is far greater than any team MJ beat, then…

paragraphs.name: 7f0f
paragraphs.text: And, if LeBron beats GSW in the Finals, an opponent who is far greater than any team MJ beat, then he’s the greatest of all time (aka GOAT).

fe0140bfe375.title: The amount of mileage on Lebron is incredible.

paragraphs.name: 7a8d
paragraphs.text: The amount of mileage on Lebron is incredible. He’s played roughly the equivalent of 3 and a half extra seasons if you add up all his career playoff minutes, and dragged some of the worst supporting casts to the finals in the process (looking back at that ’07 Cavs roster… good God). It just feels like waiting for the other shoe to drop for all this…

paragraphs.text: It’s ironic that the article ends by saying we should enjoy LeBron’s career while it lasts because it could be over soon.
Stop forcing people to confront this inane GOAT discussion and we all could. Let us all acknowledge that he’s great and let’s leave it at that, alright?

If he played hockey, he’d already be better than Gretzky! & he’d be the best…

paragraphs.name: bb65
paragraphs.text: Stop. Just freaking stop. This has to end. Doing more doesn’t make him better. He either is or isn’t. Jordan was the GOAT in 1988. Just as he was in 1991 (when the moronic “gatekeepers” finally allowed him to hold the title because he had won a title). The GOAT is someone who, at their prime, is better than everyone else. This was always MJ. This isn…

4cd85fe0b615.title: I still worry we’re closer to the end of this spectacular LeBron era than we all realize, and that…

paragraphs.name: 89c8
paragraphs.text: I still worry we’re closer to the end of this spectacular LeBron era than we all realize, and that he knows it too. IF he drags this team to the Finals, it’s starting to feel like the Ws could blow them off the court like the Spurs did. I think LeBron knows this team is not winning the title. Great piece!

b7d37cdaeab9.title: We’ll never see another LeBron James.

paragraphs.name: c6af
paragraphs.text: We’ll never see another LeBron James. Someone who, at the age of 16, was already labeled as a soon to be great, and to actually live up to the hype and exceed it. His sustainability is also an amazing feat. HGH is a hell of a drug

paragraphs.name: bdbf
paragraphs.text: I don’t know. I think that’s the media just trying to create another narrative out of an already awesome narrative. These could be the first teams ever to meet three years in a row. That’s a big deal. Just my two cents.
